definition: background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Bottom line, you bring in revenue for them, you win, they win.
sentences.chinese: 底線就是，你爲他們帶來收入，大家雙贏。

sentences.english: Some people have sacrificed principle and sought profits at the expense of public interests. They have crossed the moral baseline.
sentences.chinese: 一些人見利忘義，損害公衆利益，喪失了道德底線。

sentences.english: This equates to more productivity and a better fiscal bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，公司就會更具生產力，具有更高的財政底線。

sentences.english: Ummm, a little experiment to see where you'd draw the line.
sentences.chinese: 呃，就想試驗一下你的底線在哪裏？

sentences.english: Learn how green data centers can add more to your bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 學習綠色數據中心怎樣促進降低你的賬本底線。

sentences.english: Points left and right, to wear more comfortable, the bottom line is thick noodles.
sentences.chinese: 分左右手，佩戴更舒適，底線面線都是粗線。

sentences.english: However, set boundaries and don't let others see you as a pushover.
sentences.chinese: 而且設置底線，不要讓他人認爲你是容易受影響的人。

sentences.english: How close is too close when it comes to mothers and sons?
sentences.chinese: 母子間的親密到底有沒有底線？

sentences.english: "Is your own home, but also that there is a " marital status "the bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 就是你自己的家，也該還有個“婚否”的底線。

sentences.english: He should set a deadline to have his folks confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 他得有一個讓他的人民確認的底線。

sentences.english: Connect your work with the bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 將您的工作與底線結合起來。

sentences.english: He can get the ball towards the by-line and make them defend.
sentences.chinese: 他可以帶球直突底線，給防守方巨大壓力。

sentences.english: They meet at certain moral limits.
sentences.chinese: 兩者在某個道德底線相逢。

sentences.english: I should have communicated what my comfort level was before we went shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我應該在出發去購物之前溝通好我的消費底線。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
